Quotes: Society is not a disease, it is a disaster. What a stupid miracle that one can live in it.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Torment, for some men, is a need, an appetite, and an accomplishment.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Anyone who has declared someone else to be an idiot, a bad apple, is annoyed when it turns out in the end that he isn't.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: I assess the power of a will by how much resistance, pain, torture it endures and knows how to turn to its advantage.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: I was married by a judge. I should have asked for a jury.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: It is the strange fate of man, that even in the greatest of evils the fear of the worst continues to haunt him.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Any emotion, if it is sincere, is involuntary.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Better a broken promise than none at all.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: What is the difference between a taxidermist and a tax collector? The taxidermist takes only your skin.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: The biggest disease today is not leprosy or tuberculosis, but rather the feeling of being unwanted.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: Being unwanted, unloved, uncared for, forgotten by everybody, I think that is a much greater hunger, a much greater poverty than the person who has nothing to eat.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: Hatred is gained as much by good works as by evil.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: Pessimist: One who, when he has the choice of two evils, chooses both.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Why was I born with such contemporaries?
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: As long as man continues to be the ruthless destroyer of lower living beings he will never know health or peace. For as long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other.
Author: Pitagora

Quotes: Scepticism, that dry caries of the intelligence.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: How sharper than a serpent's tooth it is to have a thankless child!
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Nothing is sadder that a broken heart
Author: Your Quotes
